comments.body:
Is there an env var you'd add to [https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/docker/linux-r.dockerfile] ?

Or something to https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/r/inst/build_arrow_static.sh?

I think on CI we only get 2 cores so there's not room for major improvement, but every little bit helps.
There's not only CI, there's local testing and it's meant to be executed by users as well, right?
The problem is I don't know how to debug this thing. How do I tell R not to remove tempfiles?

I'm not sure exactly what you're trying to debug, but some ideas:

* https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/r/vignettes/install.Rmd discusses options and troubleshooting for the install script. Set {{ARROW_R_DEV=TRUE}} if you want more verbosity printed in the build. Set {{DEBUG_DIR}} to copy the cmake build directory somewhere not in tmp if there's a build error.
* You can call {{r/inst/build_arrow_static.sh}} directly, like the [nightly builds do|https://github.com/ursa-labs/arrow-r-nightly/blob/master/linux/docker-compose.yml#L26]
Multiple things really... That script doesn't seem to be working in all situations.

Alright, well between the checks on push and nightly on crossbow, we're testing this build script on 7 different distro/versions containing only R and its basic dependencies, and there are a couple other permutations on [https://github.com/ursa-labs/arrow-r-nightly/actions]. Clearly we want this to work as universally as possible, so if there are things that don't work, we should test them.
